item.title: ESO 2024 Global Reveal—Introducing Scribing
item.description: Discover new ways to play with Scribing, arriving as part of The Elder Scrolls Online: Gold Road.
item.content:encoded:
Discover new ways to play with Scribing, arriving as part of The Elder Scrolls Online: Gold Road.

In The Elder Scrolls Online: Gold Road (arriving June 3 on PC/Mac and June 18 on Xbox and PlayStation consoles), you can unlock access to an all-new game system: Scribing. With Scribing, you can manipulate the nature of magic itself by collecting and customizing special skills, granting you even more ways to tailor specific builds and play your way.

Customize New Skills

When designing this new system, the team focused on improving opportunities for roleplay and choice for ESO's adventurers by providing greater agency when it comes to selecting and adapting the skills that are right for them. What exactly does this mean for you and your characters? Scribing introduces Grimoires, which are new types of skills for your existing skill lines. You can customize these Grimoires beyond their basic functions, transforming them into exactly what you want on your action bar.

For example, one new Grimoire, called Soul Touch, allows you to pull soul magic from the core of your being and cast it at a nearby enemy or ally. You can customize Soul Touch by choosing its Primary, Secondary, and Tertiary Scripts. You could use the Primary to create a Damage Shield for an ally, pull an enemy to you, or even change it to Magic, Shock, or Physical Damage. In addition, you could use the Soul Infusion Secondary to enable the ability to consume a soul gem and gain Ultimate, or you can use a Recovery Secondary to regain resources for a targeted ally.

Customize your Grimoires with Scripts

The above is just one example, but the Scribing system will give you a ton of new ways to change your build and playstyle, since you can unlock a host of Grimoires and Scripts at launch.

Explore the Origins of Magic

To master the art of Scribing you'll need the Gold Road Chapter, which grants access to a brand-new questline. In this unique story, ancient magic arising in the world attracts the attention of the Mages Guild, who send one of their best to investigate.

Working alongside a brave Knight of the Lamp, you'll discover a mysterious new location and altar and discover the secrets of the mage who built it. Throughout the questline, you'll learn how to scribe, gain a Grimoire or two, and meet new friends along the way.

Ally with the Luminaries of magic

Fantastic untold lore awaits those willing to delve into the esoteric mysteries of magic, but those who commit to unraveling its secrets will find new power and freedom as they do.

Style Your Existing Skills, Too!

With the ability to mix and match a wide variety of classes, races, skills, and gear sets, ESO has always striven to provide you with the freedom and power to customize your characters' unique playstyles.

In the spirit of this core pillar, Gold Road also introduces a new type of collectible, called Skill Styles. Skill Styles are color variation of popular abilities from various weapon, guild, and world skill lines, helping you further stand out on the battlefield.

Customize existing abilities with Skill Styles

At the launch of Gold Road, you can unlock these Skill Styles as in-game rewards, but there's a lot more planned for them beyond the Chapter, too.

Play Your Way

The Elder Scrolls Online: Gold Road's new Scribing system will be a powerful and flexible new tool for Tamriel's adventurers, and we can't wait to see how the community reacts to it. Are you ready and willing to explore the mysteries of magic? Are you excited to experiment with Grimoires and Scripts to create a playstyle uniquely your own? Tell us via X (Formerly Twitter), Instagram, and Facebook.

The Elder Scrolls Online: Gold Road arrives for PC/Mac on June 3, 2024, and for Xbox and PlayStation consoles on June 18, 2024. Pre-purchase Gold Road now to receive unique bonus rewards at launch and immediate access to Welkyndstone Ruins Wolf mount and Welkyndstone Ruins Pup pet*. Don't miss out!

item.title: ESO 2024 Global Reveal—Gold Road's West Weald Zone
item.description: Discover West Weald, ESO's newest zone just announced as part of The Elder Scrolls Online: Gold Road!
item.content:encoded:
Discover West Weald, ESO's newest zone just announced as part of The Elder Scrolls Online: Gold Road!

Explore West Weald

In ESO's upcoming Gold Road Chapter (arriving June 3 for PC/Mac and June 18 for Xbox and PlayStation consoles) you can explore and quest within the West Weald zone, which introduces brand-new locations, characters, challenges, rewards, and stories. If you're already familiar with southeast Cyrodiil, this Chapter allows you to explore this bountiful part of Tamriel for the first time since 2006's The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.

Recently, strange happenings have thrown the region into turmoil, changing the landscape in bizarre ways and introducing new threats you'll have to contend with. In the southeast lies the Gold Road, a temperate environment similar to that found on the Gold Coast. It's home to the region's capital city, Skingrad, the bustling center of the zone and lynchpin for the Colovian Imperials who call the province home.

Discover (or rediscover) Skingrad

Toward the southwest, you will find Dawnwood. Formerly under Imperial control, this area is now home to the encroaching jungles of nearby Valenwood. There, you'll discover a dense wilderness and the Wood Elf settlement of Vashabar. Even more alarming is the Wildburn, a dangerous area that separates Dawnwood from the Colovian Highlands and Gold Road, comprised of sickened, magically twisted land and even more warped beasts.

In the north of West Weald lies the Colovian Highlands, a mountainous region that is home to an Imperial settlement and numerous ruins.

Venture into ancient Ayleid ruins

Classic Colovian architecture inspired many of the zone's structures, although as you explore its varied terrain you'll also encounter many Ayleid ruins that speak to an older heritage. These ruins are less “spoiled” than many other similar locations and show off structures and architectural pieces of Ayleid culture never seen before.

New Challenges and Rewards

While the land itself is changing, it is also under attack from a host of new, unfamiliar foes, bringing all-new dangers to West Weald's adventurers.

These challenges include new delves and public dungeons to explore, world bosses to face, and a bevy of stand-alone quests that tell stories unique to this zone. In addition, new world events, called Mirrormoor Incursions, set you and your fellow adventurers against waves of invading Daedra.

Gold Road also introduces a 12-player Trial, the Lucent Citadel, which has you and your band venture into a long-forgotten Daedric vault—new bosses, mysteries, and rewards await!

Prepare for a new Trial

Speaking of rewards, if you venture into the zone, you'll find that West Weald is home to no shortage of new riches. This includes 10 item sets to wear, more Antiquities to dig up, fun collectibles to unlock, and a host of Achievements and Titles to earn.

Seize the treasures of West Weald

Finally, Gold Road also introduces an entirely new type of reward collectible called Skill Styles, which provide visual changes to popular abilities, with more planned for future updates!

Wonders Old and New Await

The return of Ithelia and the Wildburn introduces threats both old and new in West Weald. Will you meet these rising dangers? Or perhaps you're excited to return to Skingrad and discover the Colovian Highlands of Tamriel's Second Era? Let us know via X (formerly Twitter), Instagram, and Facebook.

Pre-purchase Gold Road now to receive unique bonus rewards at launch and immediate access to the Welkyndstone Ruins Wolf mount and Welkyndstone Ruins Pup pet*. Don't miss out!

*The Welkyndstone Ruins Pup pet is available only until March 18, 2024.

item.title: ESO 2024 Global Reveal—The Elder Scrolls Online: Gold Road & Scions of Ithelia
item.description: Discover new adventures and revelations in The Elder Scrolls Online: Gold Road Chapter and Scions of Ithelia dungeon DLC, announced during the ESO 2024 Global Reveal.
item.content:encoded:
Discover new adventures and revelations in The Elder Scrolls Online: Gold Road Chapter and Scions of Ithelia dungeon DLC, announced during the ESO 2024 Global Reveal.

The Forgotten Prince

A secret long held by Hermaeus Mora has been uncovered and the existence of the Forgotten Prince has come to light. Now, Ithelia's return puts reality itself at risk.

Arriving March 11 for PC/Mac and March 26 for Xbox and Playstation consoles, the Scions of Ithelia dungeon DLC pack continues the story from last year's Necrom Chapter. Learn more about the spreading threat via the two dungeons featured in this pack, then experience its stunning conclusion in the upcoming Chapter, The Elder Scrolls Online: Gold Road (arriving June 3 for PC/Mac and June 18 for consoles).

Scions of Ithelia

Begin 2024's adventures with the Scions of Ithelia dungeon DLC pack in March, which introduces two new 4-player dungeons, Oathsworn Pit and Bedlam Veil.

Scions of Ithelia

These dungeons allow you to explore a training ground for the followers of Malacath and a secret vault within the Oblivion demi-realm of Maelstrom. Both dungeons help set the stage for the upcoming Chapter in their own way, but their storylines can be enjoyed individually, too.

Battle the followers of the Forgotten Prince

These two new dungeons are set to challenge you and your team with Normal and Veteran difficulties (including Hard Mode) and each feature their own Achievements and rewards (including unique collectibles and item sets).

Gold Road Chapter

Featuring a new zone, storyline, Scribing system, rewards, and more, The Elder Scrolls Online: Gold Road is now available for pre-purchase on all platforms. This new Chapter takes you to West Weald, a region situated on the borders of Cyrodiil, the Gold Coast, and Valenwood. Those Elder Scrolls fans who played 2006's The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion might be familiar with this part of Tamriel, including its capital city of Skingrad.

The Elder Scrolls Online: Gold Road

Ruled by the Colovian Count Calantius, this province is an independent nation allied to the Imperial forces occupying nearby Cyrodiil. However, seemingly overnight, the sweltering jungles of Valenwood have replaced a third of the region, and the Count seeks answers to avoid losing any more of his realm.

The unraveling of reality is everyone's problem

That said, the new forest (that the Wood Elves call Dawnwood) may not be the most pressing concern for you and your allies, as you must also investigate the reappearance of Ithelia, the Forgotten Prince.

Beware the Scions of Ithelia

While her followers cause chaos in her name, many mysteries remain. Why does she now walk West Weald, and what are her Scions' plans for her return? Reality itself hangs in the balance! While it continues a narrative that began in 2023, like Scions of Ithelia, Gold Road tells its own stand-alone tale and does not require having played the Necrom Chapter.

A Clash of Fates

The Forgotten Prince may soon return to power, and fate itself trembles in anticipation. What impact will you, a mortal adventurer, have on West Weald and its myriad threats? You'll have to play Gold Road to find out!

In the meantime, let us know your hopes and predictions for how this conflict will play out via X (formerly Twitter), Instagram, and Facebook. Keep an eye out for more information about both the new Chapter and dungeon DLC in the future, too!

item.title: Quest, Hunt, Pilfer, and Conquer during the Guilds and Glory Celebration Event
item.description: Find adventure and excitement within Wrothgar, Hew's Bane, the Gold Coast, and the Imperial City during the new Guilds & Glory Celebration in-game event.
item.content:encoded:
Find adventure and excitement within Wrothgar, Hew's Bane, the Gold Coast, and the Imperial City during the new Guilds & Glory Celebration in-game event.

(Re)Discover Classic Adventures

The Guilds and Glory Celebration begins Thursday, January 18 at 10AM EST, and runs until Tuesday, January 30 at 10AM EST. Throughout the event, as you quest and adventure within Wrothgar, Hew's Bane, the Gold Coast, and the Imperial City, you'll earn an assortment of bonus goodies including Reward Boxes and Event Tickets.

These bonus rewards include:

  • Double reward boxes earned during Daily Quests in Wrothgar, Hew's Bane, the Gold Coast, and Imperial City as well as the Maw of Lorkhaj Weekly Quests
  • Double reward boxes earned during Thieves' Guild Heists and Dark Brotherhood Sacraments
  • Increased resource node drops
    • This does not include fishing holes or crafting materials obtained from animals
  • Additional loot from World Bosses in Wrothgar, Hew's Bane, and the Gold Coast as well as Delve Bosses and Public Dungeon Bosses
  • Additional loot from Sweepers and Coldharbour Elite Guard inside Imperial City and Imperial Sewers as well as bosses in the Maw of Lorkhaj
  • Additional loot from bosses in Maelstrom Arena, Imperial City Prison, and White-Gold Tower dungeons

Return to Wrothgar and other classic DLC zones

To participate in every aspect of this new event, you will need access to the Orsinium DLC, the Thieves Guild DLC, and the Dark Brotherhood DLC. Each is available within the Crown Store or can be accessed via an ESO Plus membership. The Imperial City DLC is free for all and can be claimed from the Crown Store at no cost.

Claim Glory & Rewards

During the Guilds and Glory Celebration, you can earn Glorious Reward Boxes once per day from the first daily quest completed in Wrothgar, Hew's Bane, or the Gold Coast, or by finishing the Maw of Lorkhaj weekly quest. These Reward Boxes may contain the following items:

  • Crafting materials
  • Saleable treasures
  • A style item
    • Ancient Orc, Malacath, or Trinimac if the box is dropped in Wrothgar
    • Outlaw, Thieves' Guild, or Abah's Watch if the box is dropped in Hew's Bane
    • Assassin's League, Minotaur, Dark Brotherhood, or Order of the Hour if the box is dropped in the Gold Coast
  • Overland item set
  • Companion gear
  • A chance for one of the following items
    • Crafting recipes (from the zone in which you earn the box)
    • Treasure Maps and Survey Reports (from the zone in which you earn the box)
    • Motif chapters
      • Ancient Orc, Malacath, or Trinimac if the box is dropped in Wrothgar
      • Outlaw, Thieves' Guild, or Abah's Watch if the box is dropped in Hew's Bane
      • Assassin's League, Minotaur, Dark Brotherhood, or Order of the Hour if the box is dropped in the Gold Coast
  • A chance for a Bristleback Hunter outfit style page

Earn a host of rewards including a new style

In addition, you can collect more common Regular Reward Boxes by completing consecutive dailies in the event-related zones. These may contain the following items:

  • Crafting materials
  • A chance for saleable treasures
  • A chance for a style item
    • Ancient Orc, Malacath, or Trinimac if the box is dropped in Wrothgar
    • Outlaw, Thieves' Guild, or Abah's Watch if the box is dropped in Hew's Bane
    • Assassin's League, Minotaur, Dark Brotherhood, or Order of the Hour if the box is dropped in the Gold Coast
  • Overland item set
  • A chance for Companion gear
  • A small chance for one of the following items
    • Furnishing recipes (from the zone in which you earn the box)
    • Treasure Maps and Survey Reports ( from the zone in which you earn the box)
    • Motif chapters
      • Ancient Orc, Malacath, or Trinimac if the box is dropped in Wrothgar
      • Outlaw, Thieves' Guild, or Abah's Watch if the box is dropped in Hew's Bane
      • Assassin's League, Minotaur, Dark Brotherhood, or Order of the Hour if the box is dropped in the Gold Coast.
  • A small chance for a Bristleback Hunter outfit style page

Pilfer or slay your way to new riches

You may also receive a second Glorious Reward Box once per day by looting the final boss within the Imperial City Prison, White-Gold Tower, and Maelstrom Arena. These Reward Boxes may contain the following items:

  • Crafting materials
  • Saleable treasures
  • A style item
    • Ancient Orc, Malacath, or Trinimac
    • Outlaw, Thieves' Guild, or Abah's Watch
    • Assassin's League, Minotaur, Dark Brotherhood, or Order of the Hour
    • Xivkyn, Aldmeri Dominion, Daggerfall Covenant, or Ebonheart Pact
  • Dungeon item set, from Imperial City Prison, White-Gold Tower, or Maelstrom Arena
  • Companion gear
  • One of the following items
    • Furnishing recipes
    • Treasure Maps and Survey Reports
    • Motif chapters
      • Ancient Orc, Malacath, or Trinimac
      • Outlaw, Thieves' Guild, or Abah's Watch
      • Assassin's League, Minotaur, Dark Brotherhood, or Order of the Hour
      • Xivkyn, Aldmeri Dominion, Daggerfall Covenant, or Ebonheart Pact
  • A chance for a Bristleback Hunter outfit style page

You can also earn Regular Reward Boxes by looting the final boss of an event-related dungeon subsequent times. These may contain the following items:

  • Crafting materials
  • A chance for saleable treasures
  • A chance for a style item
    • Ancient Orc, Malacath, or Trinimac
    • Outlaw, Thieves' Guild, or Abah's Watch
    • Assassin's League, Minotaur, Dark Brotherhood, or Order of the Hour
    • Xivkyn, Aldmeri Dominion, Daggerfall Covenant, or Ebonheart Pact
  • Dungeon item set, from Imperial City Prison, White-Gold Tower, or Maelstrom Arena
  • A chance for Companion gear
  • A small chance for one of the following items
    • Furnishing recipes
    • Treasure Maps and Survey Reports
    • Motif chapters
      • Ancient Orc, Malacath, or Trinimac
      • Outlaw, Thieves' Guild, or Abah's Watch
      • Assassin's League, Minotaur, Dark Brotherhood, or Order of the Hour
      • Xivkyn, Aldmeri Dominion, Daggerfall Covenant, or Ebonheart Pact
  • A small chance for a Bristleback Hunter outfit style page

Battle in the heart of the empire

Lastly, you can collect a third Glorious Reward Box once per day after you complete your first Imperial City daily quest or slay your first Sweeper boss. Additionally, there is a chance to receive a Glorious Reward Box after felling a Coldharbour Elite Guard. These Rewards Boxes may contain the following items:

  • Crafting materials
  • Tel Var Stones
  • Imperial City Key Fragments
  • Saleable treasures
  • A style item
    • Xivkyn, Aldmeri Dominion, Daggerfall Covenant, or Ebonheart Pact
  • Imperial City item set
  • One of the following items
    • Furnishing Recipes from Wrothgar, Hew's Bane, or the Gold Coast
    • Cyrodiil Treasure Maps
    • Motif chapters
      • Xivkyn, Aldmeri Dominion, Daggerfall Covenant, or Ebonheart Pact
  • A chance for a Bristleback Hunter outfit style page

Regular Reward Boxes may also be earned by finishing subsequent Imperial City dailies, killing additional Sweeper bosses, and defeating additional Coldharbour Elite Guards. These may contain the following items:

  • Crafting materials
  • Tel Var Stones
  • A chance for Imperial City Key Fragments
  • A chance for a saleable treasure
  • A chance for a style item
    • Xivkyn, Aldmeri Dominion, Daggerfall Covenant, or Ebonheart Pact
  • Imperial City item set
  • A chance for one of the following items
    • Furnishing recipes from Wrothgar, Hew's Bane, or the Gold Coast
    • Cyrodiil Treasure Maps
    • Motif chapters
      • Xivkyn, Aldmeri Dominion, Daggerfall Covenant, or Ebonheart Pact
  • A small chance for a Bristleback Hunter outfit style page

Additionally, you can collect further Regular Reward Boxes by participating in the following activities:

  • Slaying World Bosses in the Wrothgar, Hew's Bane, or the Gold Coast zones
  • Defeating the final boss in Imperial City Prison, White-Gold Tower, or Maelstrom Arena dungeons
  • Opening treasure chests
  • Opening safeboxes
  • Looting objects such as barrels, crates, etc.
  • Looting Psijic portals
  • Cracking open Thieves Troves
  • Harvesting crafting resource nodes

Phew! That's a TON of ways to earn a host of bonus rewards during this massive new in-game event. Whether you're stalking your prey on behalf of the Dark Brotherhood, pilfering unsuspecting nobles with your Thieves Guild allies, battling your fellow players in the Imperial City, or delving into the politics and strife of the home of the Orcs, this event has bonus rewards for you!

Impresario & Event Tickets

Of course, we can't forget about those precious Event Tickets! During the Guilds and Glory Celebration, you will receive two Event Tickets for the first of the following activities completed each day:

  • Daily Delve and World Boss quests in Wrothgar
  • Daily Delve, World Boss, and Thieves' Guild quests in Hew's Bane
  • Daily Delve, World Boss, and Dark Brotherhood quests in the Gold Coast
  • Daily Quests in Imperial City
  • Weekly Trial Quest for Maw of Lorkhaj
  • Killing and looting a Sweeper in Imperial City
  • Killing and looting a Coldharbour Elite Guard in Imperial City Sewers
  • Killing and looting the final boss of Imperial City Prison and White-Gold Tower
  • Killing and looting the final boss of Maelstrom Arena

By the end of the event, you could have earned an impressive 26 Tickets total! But keep in mind, you can only carry 12 Tickets at one time. To help you lighten the load, here's what the Impresario has in stock during the event:

  • All three Molag Bal Illusion Imp pet fragments
    • Anchor Chain Fragment
    • Dark Anchor Pinion
    • Effigy of the Dominator
  • The first Planemeld's Master marking fragment
    • Crematory Ash
  • Bound style pages for the following:
    • Bristleback Hunter outfit style
  • Stonefire Scamp Pet
  • Soul-Shriven Skin
  • Impresario Group Repair Kits
  • Companion Guild Commendations

The Molag Bal Illusion Imp pet

The Guilds and Glory Celebration is your first chance this year to purchase Crematory Ash, the first of three morphing fragments for the Planemeld's Master markings!

The Planemeld's Master markings

Additionally, the Impresario's Assistant, Philius Dormier, will gladly take your precious Event Tickets in exchange for some tantalizing treasures:

  • Unstable Morpholith Pet Fragments
  • Doomchar Plateau House Fragments

Last but not least, Nenulaure the Indrik Vendor is ready to barter away the following goodies:

  • Nascent Indrik Feathers
  • Dawnwood Indrik Berries
  • Spectral Indrik Berries
  • Springtide Indrik Pet
  • Haunting Indrik Pet

Greatness Waits for No One

Adventure across Wrothgar, Hew's Bane, the Gold Coast, and the Imperial City and you'll earn a mountain of bonus rewards during the Guilds and Glory Celebration. Are you ready to find glory, honor, and untold riches during this new in-game event? Share your story with us via Twitter, Instagram, or Facebook!

The Guilds and Glory Celebration in-game event begins next Thursday, January 18 at 10AM EST, and continues until Tuesday, January 30 at 10AM EST.

item.title: Experience Echoes of the Planemeld with the New 2024 Morphing Event Collectible
item.description: Show your defiance of and/or allegiance to the God of Schemes with this year's morphing collectible, the Molag Bal Illusion Imp pet!
item.content:encoded:
Show your defiance of and/or allegiance to the God of Schemes with this year's morphing collectible, the Molag Bal Illusion Imp pet!

Molag Bal, Daedric Prince of Brutality and Domination, has long been a menace to Tamriel. This year, throughout ESO's 2024 in-game events, you can exchange your Event Tickets for a semblance of the Daedric Prince via this year's morphing collectible, the Molag Bal Illusion Imp pet!

Morphing collectibles can take many forms over the course of a year. If you're unfamiliar with how they work, you can read more about them in this guide.

Molag Bal Illusion Imp Pet

As has been the case in past years, you'll need to collect three different fragments to summon this specific collectible:

· Anchor Chain Fragment

· Dark Anchor Pinion

· Effigy of the Dominator

These three fragments will be available for purchase with Event Tickets during each of 2024's major in-game events. Just visit the Impresario during any of her appearances throughout the year to acquire them. Once you have all three fragments, combine them in your Collections to unlock access to this malevolent mite.

As a morphing collectible, the Molag Bal Illusion Imp can also be combined with other fragments to summon a different collectible event reward each quarter of this year, starting with the Planemeld's Master Body and Face Markings.

Planemeld's Master Body and Face Markings

Be sure to be on the lookout for more information on upcoming events and their reward fragments, starting with the Guilds and Glory event later this month. Are you excited to show this simulacrum of Molag Bal just who's in charge, or will you pledge your fealty to the Lord of Lies before it? Let us know via X (Formerly Twitter), Instagram, and Facebook.

item.content:encoded:

The Pyromancer's Quandary emote

We're crafting something special this year for The Elder Scrolls Online, so be sure to join the #ESOFam in watching the livestream via Twitch.tv/Bethesda starting on Thursday, January 18 at 4PM EST.

item.title: Crown Store Showcase—January 2024
item.description: Start the new year off right by picking up something fun from the Crown Store this January.
item.content:encoded:
Start the new year off right by picking up something fun from the Crown Store this January.

Check out the complete list of contents of items coming to the Crown Store in January 2024 below. Don't forget, you can head over to the Crown Store page right now to view all offers currently available and visit the Buy Crowns page to pick up however many crowns you need. Certain items and offers will only be available for a limited time, so be sure to read their details below and don't miss out.


ESO Plus Deals

All ESO Plus™ members have access to a monthly selection of exclusive deals and items. You can find more information about them in this article.

Exclusive Free Items

Statuette: Dwemer Guardian

A miniature statue of a sentinel found outside many Dwarven ruins in Morrowind.

The Statuette: Dwemer Guardian will be available in the Crown Store FREE exclusively to ESO Plus Members on all platforms for a limited time, from January 4 to February 15, 2024, at 10AM EST.


Adornments

Hair

The Heroic Poet

Oh, you romantic devil, tossing off quatrains and epigrams as you charge into battle to defend the underdog! You know who you are, and this is your hair.

The Heroic Poet hairstyle will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 8 to January 11, 2024, at 10AM EST. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Hat

Deep Elf Executioner's Hood

Ancient engravings tell us that a Dwarven executioner, or "Chun Abakch," always concealed his or her features under a hood of black spidersilk, a material that was also used by the Dwemer for funeral shrouds.

The Deep Elf Executioner's Hood Hat returns to the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 8 to January 11, 2024, at 10AM EST.


Tattoos

Meridian Sunburst Face Tattoos

Celebrate the brightest light of all the Lady's Infinite Energies with these glowing Meridian Sunburst Tattoos.

The Meridian Sunburst Face Tattoos will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 11 to January 18, 2024, at 10AM EST. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Meridian Sunburst Body Tattoos

Celebrate the brightest light of all the Lady's Infinite Energies with these glowing Meridian Sunburst Tattoos.

The Meridian Sunburst Body Tattoos will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 11, 2024, to January 18, 2024, at 10AM EST. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Skins

Opalescent Epidermis

Shimmer with a variety of hues, taking on the colors of the famed opals of Yokuda, with this skin. Perfect for star-strewn celebrations in Sentinel and beyond.

The Opalescent Epidermis skin will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms starting January 16 to January 22, 2024, at 10AM EST. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Wardrobe

Costumes

Toxin Doctor

When you specialize in venoms and poison-making, you invest in special protective garb to keep from being poisoned by your own experiments—or else! And if your clients are just a little intimidated by your creepy attire, all the better.

The Toxin Doctor costume will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 2 to January 8, 2024, at 10AM EST. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Auroran Knight

Aurorans are idealized humanoid Daedra mainly in the service of Meridia, the Lady of Infinite Energies. Their armor usually appears golden in tone, but since they come from the Colored Rooms, they could be of any hue.

The Auroran Knight costume will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 11 to January 18, 2024, at 10AM EST. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Gem Prospector

If you love chipping away at rock until you reveal raw gemstone, garb yourself appropriately. Crafted from sturdy materials, this costume features pockets, pouches, and gear that allow you to better find and remove natural riches.

The Gem Prospector costume paired with the Gemcutter's Spectacles adornment will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 16 to January 22, 2024, at 10AM EST. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Imperial Officer Pack

This pack includes costumes of three different armor sets as worn by Tribunes and Centurions of the Imperial Legions. Hail the Red Diamond!

The Imperial Officer Pack will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 22 to January 25, 2024, at 10AM EST. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Orc Wise Woman's Vestment

"As the Wise Woman of your clan, or the Hunt-Wife on ceremonial days, you must project both grace and authority," says designer Borzighu the Tidy. "Count on my gilt-broidered vestment to provide that, and more!"

The Orc Wise Woman's Vestment costume will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 25 to January 29, 2024, at 10AM EST. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Soul-Shriven Costume Pack

When the Soul-Shriven arrive in Coldharbour, they are garbed in cast-off armor taken from the dead. This pack includes costumes in various states of raggedness.

The Soul-Shriven Costume Pack will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 29 to February 1, 2024, at 10AM EST. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Crafting

Motifs

Crown Crafting Motif: Dreadhorn Style

Gherig Bullblood proclaims, “Wayward sons and daughters, embrace Domihaus and set to work to outfit our reborn clan—as the Dreadhorn!" Use of this motif enables crafting in the Dreadhorn style.

The Crown Crafting Motifs: Dreadhorn returns to the Crown Store on all platforms starting January 2 to January 8, 2024, at 10AM EST. Dreadhorn Motif chapters, and very rarely the complete book, have a chance to drop from Domihaus the Bloody-Horned in Falkreath Hold.


Crown Crafting Motif: Silver Dawn

Hunt for heinous were-creatures with pride wearing and wielding the traditional arms and armor of the Order of the Silver Dawn! By the gleam of silver shall we slay! Use to learn the Silver Dawn crafting style.

The Crown Crafting Motif: Silver Dawn returns to the Crown Store on all platforms starting January 16 to January 22, 2024, at 10AM EST. Silver Dawn Motif chapters, and very rarely the complete book, have a chance to drop from Vykosa the Ascendant in Moon Hunter Keep.


Crown Crafting Motif: New Moon Priest

The Arcane Quartermaster of Order of the New Moon states, "Some believe that the order grows too quickly. This one says we should embrace newcomers and provide appropriate priestly garments! Fadai gladly offers guidance on crafting vestments and how best to incorporate aeonstones into them." Use to learn the New Moon Priest crafting style. Also acquired from the Dragonguard Supply Chest in the Dragonguard Santum.

The Crown Crafting Motif: New Moon Priest will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms starting January 25 to January 29, 2024, at 10AM EST. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item. New Moon Priest Motif chapters can be acquired from the Dragonguard Supply Chest in the Dragonguard Sanctum.


Outfit Styles

Elder Scrolls Artifact: Rueful Axe

Alter your two-handed axe's Outfit style with a replica of the Rueful Axe Elder Scrolls Artifact, a weapon created by the Daedric Prince Clavicus Vile.

The Elder Scrolls Artifact: Rueful Axe will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms starting January 2 to January 11, 2024, at 10AM EST. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Gloambound Arms Pack

Need a weapon in a hurry? Let the Evergloam provide! Alter your weapon's appearance to match the Gloambound Weapons by using this complete set of Outfit styles. Stowing these weapons will hide them when equipped.

The Gloambound Arms Pack will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms starting January 4 to January 11, 2024, at 10AM EST. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Lord Warden Arms Pack

Urgarlag Chief-bane notes to Undaunted pledgers, "The Lord Warden obsessively keeps record of every indignity he's inflicted. Wipe the record clean before you turn the tables on him." Alter your weapon's appearance to match the Undaunted Lord Warden awards by using this complete set of Outfit styles.

The Lord Warden Arms Pack will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms starting January 16 to January 22, 2024, at 10AM EST. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item. The matching mask page will have a small chance to drop from Lord Warden Dusk from Veteran Imperial City Prison. The matching shoulder page can be purchased from Urgarlag Chief-bane for 50 Undaunted keys, or has a chance of dropping from Urgarlag's Mystery Coffer for 1 key. Having the achievement “Lord Warden's Retaliation” increases the drop chances of both items.


Elder Scrolls Artifact: Dawnbreaker

Alter your one-handed weapon's Outfit style with a replica of the Dawnbreaker Elder Scrolls Artifact, a weapon forged by the Daedric Prince Meridia.

The Elder Scrolls Artifact: Dawnbreaker will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms starting January 11 to January 18, 2024, at 10AM EST. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Bristleback Hunter Arms Pack

Keama of Markarth says, “When I see someone wearing this gear swagger into the Hunter's Repose, I know we'll have a full night of near-death stories. Bristlebacks take skill and luck to kill.” Alter your weapon's appearance by using this complete set of Bristleback Hunter Outfit styles.

The new Bristleback Hunter Arms Pack will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms during the Guilds and Glory Celebration event. Matching armor pages will have a small chance to drop from Event Reward Boxes. Bound versions of the armor pages can be purchased from the Impresario for 5 Event Tickets each during the event.


Crate

Psijic Vault Crate

A mystery collection of Psijic Order-related items!

Psijic Vault Crates return to the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 18 to February 1, 2024, at 10AM EST.


Events

Currency

Event Tickets

A ticket used to purchase rare goods from The Impresario, Event Merchant. Curious as to what goods? Well, chat with her to see what she has to offer!

Single Event Tickets will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time during the Guilds and Glory Celebration in-game event. Stay tuned for event details!


Bundles

Highland Spotted Lynx Bundle

From curious cub to lithe mount, the spotted lynxes found in the Colovian highlands help keep the area free of vermin and often serve as mounts to worthy souls. This feline bundle allows you to add these two furry friends to your adventures.

The new Highland Spotted Lynx Bundle will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 22 to January 29, 2024, at 10AM EST.


Furniture

Statue, Ancestor-King Auri-El

Ayleid artist-enchanters captured the might of the king of the Aldmer and his avian companion in this commanding statue! Light up this focal piece with the eagle's golden glow, Auri-El's lambent eyes, scintillating sunbeams, or a combination of these.

The Statue, Ancestor-King Auri-El will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 4 to January 11, 2024, at 10AM EST. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Island Assortment Household Pack

A selection of household necessities drawn from cultures across southern Tamriel, ideal for the Grand Topal Hideaway.

The Island Assortment Household Pack returns to the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 4 to January 11, 2024, at 10AM EST.


Meridia, Lady of Infinite Energies

"[…] above all others they did venerate the Lady of Light, building for Merid-Nunda a chapel of colored rays and beams, which was for glory like a piece of Aetherius brought down to the mortal world […]"—The Whithering of Delodiil (Author Unknown)

The Meridia, Lady of Infinite Energies statue will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 11, 2024, to January 18, 2024, at 10AM EST. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Music Box, Dawnbreaker's Forging

When activated, plays a music box arrangement of the exultant "Dawnbreaker's Forging" composition.

The new Music Box, Dawnbreaker's Forging will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 11 to January 18, 2024, at 10AM EST.


Furnishing Pack: Malacath's Chosen

Honor Malacath and his Orc-children with these furnishings from the ancient mountain strongholds of Wrothgar.

The Furnishing Pack: Malacath's Chosen will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 18 to January 25, 2024, at 10AM EST. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Furnishing Pack: Hubalajad's Final Treasure

No Prince of the Ra Gada would be caught dead without the appropriate (and extravagant) funerary offerings for his tomb. Not to mention the requisite Mournful Aegis to welcome any unexpected guests!

The Furnishing Pack: Hubalajad's Final Treasure returns to the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 25 to February 1, 2024, at 10AM EST.


Houses

Colossal Aldmeri Grotto

Once a watering stop for the High Elf navy, this great cavernous grotto on the Summerset coast west of Dusk features shipboard compartments, magnificent Aldmeri ruins, weathered wood from several shipwrecks, and a sparkling subterranean waterfall.

The Colossal Aldmeri Grotto returns to the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 4 to January 18, 2024, at 10AM EST. Furnished and unfurnished versions will be available.


Pariah's Pinnacle

The grand and majestic mountaintop retreat of Baloth Bloodtusk was sealed off in the First Era by King Joile, but its ancient Orcish halls were recently reopened by order of King Kurog.

The Pariah's Pinnacle returns to the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 18 to January 25, 2024, at 10AM EST. Furnished and unfurnished versions will be available.


Thieves' Oasis

With its mix of Redguard architecture, both old and new, Thieves' Oasis features a stunning waterfall, ancient statues, and housing fit for a prince—whether that prince is a scholarly antiquarian or roguish thief.

The Thieves' Oasis returns to the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 25 to February 8, 2024, at 10AM EST. Furnished and unfurnished versions will be available.


Houseguests

Captain Isara Davaux

Ghostly Isara may think she's still part of the All Flags Navy, fighting their ancient foes, but that just makes her a hauntingly novel guest. After adding Isara to your home, you can set her on a path, plus you and your visitors can speak with her.

Captain Isara Davaux returns to the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 4 to January 11, 2024, at 10AM EST.


M'aiq the Liar

The Khajiit called M'aiq the Liar travels widely, speaking foolishly—or wisely, depending on whom you ask. Host him before deciding, yes? After adding M'aiq to your home, you can set him on a path, plus you and your visitors can speak with him.

M'aiq the Liar will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 18 to January 25, 2024, at 10AM EST. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Mounts

Snow Bear

The Snow Bear makes a superior mount for northern climes, as it's undaunted by even the fiercest winter weather.

The Snow Bear mount will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 2 to January 8, 2024, at 10AM EST. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Harpy's Bane Durzog

"All durzog are relentless in the pursuit of prey, but this sub-species is particularly vicious, especially when following a harpy's scent. Even experienced handlers sometimes struggle to contain their ferocity on the hunt."—Elsweyr: A Rider's Guide

The Harpy's Bane Durzog mount will be available to ESO Plus Members in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 2 to February 1, 2024, at 10AM EST.


Auroran Zenith Warwolf

Followers of Meridia who assist Aurorans can gain enough favor to earn one of their wolf steeds. Trained for war, these wolves stay the course even in siege situations, making them excellent mounts for all manner of dangerous situations.

The Auroran Zenith Warwolf Mount will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 11 to January 18, 2024, at 10AM EST. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.

Great Elk

Though the Reachmen of Markarth say they were the first to successfully domesticate the Great Elk of Skyrim and break them as mounts, the Nords of Haafingar say it was really all their idea.

The Great Elk Mount returns to the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 11 to January 18, 2024, at 10AM EST.

Pets

Blue Shock Nixad

The rare and colorful Shock Nixad looks rather like a tiny, winged Storm Atronach, though without the whirling electric rocks. They make loyal companions—though they may also make your hair stand on end!

The Blue Shock Nixad pet will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 2 to January 8, 2024, at 10AM EST. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.

Seht's Dovah-Fly

These are clearly fabricants, clockwork simulations of living creatures, with the distinctive appearance of the handiwork of Sotha Sil. But if so, how did they escape Clockwork City? What powers them? And why do they make such loyal pets? No one knows.

The Seht's Dovah-Fly pet will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 8 to January 11, 2024, at 10AM EST. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.


Mudcrab of Eternal Doom

Few can withstand the scorching heat and relentless desolation of the Deadlands. Those unlucky few who find themselves trapped there may encounter one of these scuttling horrors—a hideous reminder of their grim and eternal fate.

The Mudcrab of Eternal Doom pet returns to the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 16 to January 22, 2024, at 10AM EST.

Colovian Badger

Though Badgers mainly eat burrowing rodents, farmers hate them because they'll take chickens, kwama scribs, and bantam guar if they get the chance. Cranky and irritable, they make terrible pets—which makes them a favorite among the Undaunted.

The Colovian Badger pet will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 22 to January 25, 2024, at 10AM EST. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.

Psijic Mascot Bear Cub

By tradition, the Psijic Mascot of the order's Ritemaster is always a Bear Cub—but since there's been only one Ritemaster, Iachesis, for over 3,000 years, the tradition hasn't had much opportunity to change. Fortunately, others can befriend them as well!

The Psijic Mascot Bear Cub pet will be available in the Crown Store on all platforms for a limited time, from January 25 to February 1, 2024, at 10AM EST. ESO Plus Members will receive a discount on this item.

White River Ice Wolf Pup

The Ice Wolves that lope along the White River of northeast Skyrim are associated with both the goddess Mara and the Wolf Totem of Atmora—but it's mighty hard to think of their mythic stature when you're rolling around in the snow with an Ice Wolf Puppy!

item.title: Studio Director's Letter: ESO's 2023 Retrospective & the Future
item.description: Matt Firor, ZeniMax Online Studio's Studio Director, breaks down a special year for The Elder Scrolls Online and discusses its future.
item.content:encoded:
Matt Firor, ZeniMax Online Studio's Studio Director, breaks down a special year for The Elder Scrolls Online and discusses its future.


Greetings everyone—it's time to look back at ESO in 2023 and look forward to 2024.

In 2023, our #1 priority—besides shipping Necrom and Infinite Archive—was to make the service more stable. The hardware refresh of all game servers finished in 2023, and even though we have some more non-player-facing hardware swaps to go, we are all reaping the benefits of more modern and powerful servers powering ESO's infrastructure. We also have refined our processes to ensure that updates launch with fewer issues, and for the great majority of situations, we achieved that. We did have longer downtimes than usual a few times due to the hardware refresh, but looking back, I'm pretty happy with where things are—especially after our Epic Games Store launch in July, where we saw our highest monthly active user numbers since 2015.

Necrom was our highest-rated Chapter (in some ratings, highest since Summerset), and shows our commitment to amazing storytelling. I'm especially happy with how the Apocrypha zone turned out. Adding to the Elder Scrolls lore on Daedric realms is something we take great pride in, and I think we nailed the combination of obsession with knowledge and creepy visuals that are the hallmark of Hermaeus Mora. And for the first time in a few years, the story will continue in 2024, as the 2023 story (no spoilers here!) ended on a cliffhanger.

And wrapping up 2023, we launched Infinite Archive, adding a challenging, repeatable game mode to ESO. This is a type of content that we want to do more of in the future: really fun, challenging experiences with great rewards that players can enjoy for a long time. ESO is always about great storytelling, so we won't abandon story quests and content, but we will balance it out with more systems like dungeons, trials, and special new content like Infinite Archive.

Looking forward to 2024, the obvious first thing to note is that April 4, 2024, is ESO's 10-year anniversary, marking a decade since we launched on PC/Mac. Reaching this milestone with the game in such great shape will be an amazing achievement—and we will celebrate with both in-game and real-life events. You already know about the first two: our 10-Year Anniversary community event in Amsterdam in April and a 10-Year Anniversary-themed ESO Tavern in Germany from July 13-14. Stay tuned for more information about all these events, and I certainly hope to see you in person at one or more of them!

Also, I remind you that April 4, 2024, is the 10-year anniversary of the PC/Mac launch, but many of you didn't join the community until June 2015, at ESO's massive console launch. As such, we are considering the entirety of April 2024 through July 2025 as our 10-year anniversary period, and we will fill it as much as we can with special events, retrospectives, and lots of other fun stuff to celebrate you, our community, and the ESO dev team. We can't wait to share all of this with you when we are ready.

Next year will kick off with a Global Reveal show in January, and we are excited to continue the story from last year but in a different part of Tamriel. It's going to be great, and we have some new systems that I think everyone will want to hear about. I'm not going to spoil it now, but you should definitely look out for the Global Reveal announcement and mark your calendars!

Finally, I'd like to take a moment to talk about all of us in the ESO community. Now that we are a year or so past the pandemic, it's good to take stock of where we are and where we want to go.

ESO is in a great place—enjoyed by millions. In fact, almost two million of you joined ESO last year, not counting the players enjoying the game for free from the Epic Games Store. We have been massively successful for many years now, and we are very thankful for all of you who have helped make this happen. As we approach the 10th anniversary of this amazing experience, I would just like everyone to acknowledge the path we've been on and appreciate the hard work we have all done to keep ESO amazing. It takes a village to develop and operate a game like this, and that village absolutely includes everyone reading this right now. Thanks so much for everything you do for ESO.

See you in Tamriel!

item.content:encoded:
Commemorate a decade of The Elder Scrolls Online and our amazing community with a special in-person event that kicks off our massive 10th Anniversary Celebration!

Celebrating 10 Amazing Years

Next year, The Elder Scrolls Online will reach its 10th anniversary since it first launched on PC/Mac in April 2014. To celebrate this incredible milestone, we're kicking off a massive 10th Anniversary Celebration in April.

During the celebration, we'll look back on ESO's history and celebrate the game itself, its dedicated group of developers, its passionate, ever-growing community, and its bright future.

Whether you've been a member of the #ESOFam since early beta, have recently begun your journey into Tamriel, or are looking for a new epic online roleplaying game—you won't want to miss this incredible celebration. It all kicks off next year in Amsterdam!

Join Us in Amsterdam

The fun begins next year with the first ESO 10-Year Celebration Event, a two-day in-person event we're hosting at the SugarFactory just outside of Amsterdam, Netherlands, from Friday, April 5, until Saturday, April 6. You can grab your tickets now by visiting the official signup website below.


At the event, you can mix and mingle with your fellow ESO adventurers and developers while enjoying two days of fun. This will include developer panels and roundtable discussions (with some livestreamed), hands-on gameplay, food and drink, live music, community activities, and more. In addition, the April 2024 event will host our first-ever in-person ESO cosplay competition, so if you've got an amazing ESO costume in mind that you think the community will love and are planning to attend, get crafting!

We'll share more specifics on the event with the community in the future, so keep an eye out on elderscrollsonline.com and our social channels.

Celebrate ESO with Us!

We're planning to make this the biggest in-person community event we've ever had, but it's not the only one we plan to host during this massive anniversary celebration. There's going to be a ton of special 10th Anniversary in-person events all over the globe throughout, including a big one in the United States in 2025.

Celebrate ESO's anniversary with us!

Stay tuned for additional announcements in April 2024 when we unveil more.

Take a look at some of the free rewards available to you simply by logging in to ESO this December 2023!

Gift yourself fine Crown Crate goods.

item.title: Crown Store Gifting Update – October 2023
item.content:encoded:
Following up on Studio Director Matt Firor's message last month about the current and future status of Crown Store Gifting, we are moving forward with re-enabling this functionality for eligible players at the account level. In this post, we will detail what to expect.

In September, we temporarily disabled Crown Store gifting due to a rapidly growing issue of "bad actors" using various fraudulent means to amass crowns without paying for them, then using them in turn to sell Crown Store items to players for real-world cash outside of the game client. That said, we recognize that gifting is a meaningful part of our community, and we are in the process of manually re-enabling Crown Store gifting access for select players who meet our specific criteria. This work will be complete tomorrow, October 11, during the maintenance window from 09:00 AM ET to 12:00 PM ET.

Gifting eligibility is determined by an evolving list of factors including but not limited to the account being at least 180 days past its first login and previous engagement with in-game features. You may check if you have access to gifting in-game via the Crown Store as well as via your billing history page in the ESO account center. If you have access to Crown Store gifting, you will see "Allow Crown Store Gifting" in your billing history. If you try to send a gift via the in-game Crown Store and do not have access, you will see a "Gifting Locked" pop-up message. Please note that we are exploring better ways to display this information in-game in the future, such as updating the Gifting Tutorial.

If you do not have access to Crown Store gifting after it is re-enabled on October 11, 2023, and wish for a review of your account, please visit https://help.elderscrollsonline.com and submit a Customer Support ticket. Please choose the Billing / Purchase / Code category then Platform > I have a question about a sale / offer > I want to send gift items from this account.

We appreciate everyone's understanding and patience while we get this solution up and running. Multiple teams have worked long hours to evaluate the best technical solutions that we could stand up in a reasonably short time, while also prioritizing the Crown Store gifting player experience. We are dedicated to continuing to explore ways to make this better and reduce fraudulent activity in ESO. Thanks again for being a part of our community and for your continued support.

item.title: New Patcher Rollout
item.content:encoded:
Hello everyone! After plenty of testing during the last PTS period, we are pleased to announce the rollout of our new patcher on the live servers for PC/Mac. The rollout of the new patcher will happen in four phases, with new countries being added during each phase. As we give countries access to the new patcher, we will make note of it in the list below by noting next to the country name (has the new patcher.) We will also note what phase we are currently in by specifying whether it has not started, in progress, or complete, next to the phase number.   3. Czech Republic/ Finland (Has the new patcher)
  4. Norway/ Denmark (Has the new patcher)
